author: Daniel Arkin
description: This is a free article for Diddy on Trial newsletter subscribers.
title: Sean Combs' lawyers portray ‘hotel nights’ as consensual encounters

author: Jeff Cox, CNBC
description: Under normal circumstances, moderating inflation and a weakening labor market would make an easy case for interest rate cuts
title: A 'shadow' Fed chair could be coming. Who it could be and how markets might react.

author: Tim Stelloh
description: Lawyers for Karen Read rested their case Wednesday, nearly two weeks after they began mounting a defense that sought to undermine allegations that she drunkenly backed her SUV into her boyfriend, a Boston police officer, and left him for dead three years ago
title: Karen Read murder trial: Defense lawyers rest their case

author: Ben Kamisar
description: The Democratic National Committee determined it failed to follow internal rules in the February election. Separately, Hogg’s plans to back primaries against incumbent Democrats stirred controversy.
title: DNC will redo party elections for David Hogg and Malcolm Kenyatta's posts after procedural error

author: Joyann Jeffrey, TODAY
description: Kristen Bell says there’s one thing that fans always tell her about her hit Netflix show “Nobody Wants This.”While speaking about the series with NBC News correspondent Jacob Soboroff in a joint interview her co-star Adam Brody, Bell revealed the common thing people tell her when they talk about her rom-com.“This has happened to me, I’m going to say — and I don’t think I’m exaggerating — six times where I’ve had different women in my life... like a girl in my choir class was
title: Kristen Bell reveals the one thing 'Nobody Wants This' fans say to her

author: Phil Helsel
description: The federal judge presiding over Mahmoud Khalil’s case on Wednesday ruled that the Trump administration, for now, cannot deport or detain the Columbia University activist based on a determination by U.S.
title: Government can't hold or deport Columbia activist Mahmoud Khalil, federal judge rules

author: Gina Vivinetto
description: Addison Rae is now going by a new stage name
title: Singer and TikTok star Addison Rae changes her stage name

author: The Politics Desk
description: Steve Kornacki looks at the role President Donald Trump will play in the New Jersey gubernatorial race now that the general election is set.
title: Why Trump could be the X factor in New Jersey: From the Politics Desk

author: Denise Chow
description: The first-ever images of the sun’s south pole reveal a messy jumble of magnetic activity in a never-before-seen region of our nearest star
title: European probe snaps first images of the sun's south pole

author: Courtney Kube
description: President Trump’s deployment of thousands of troops and Marines to Los Angeles is fueling concern that they have not been properly trained to interact with civilians.
title: Some Los Angeles officials fear Marines' 'rules of force'

author: Bruna Horvath
description: A Wisconsin watchdog group has filed a lawsuit against Elon Musk claiming that he unlawfully bribed voters with million-dollar checks.
title: Wisconsin group sues Elon Musk, alleging million-dollar check giveaways were voter bribes

author: Natasha Korecki
description: President Donald Trump has promised swift retribution for any violence against law enforcement by protesters in Los Angeles.“IF THEY SPIT, WE WILL HIT, and I promise you they will be hit harder than they have ever been hit before,” he wrote on his social media platform after making a similar statement a day earlier to reporters.
title: From a 'day of love' to 'if they spit, we will hit': Trump's about-face on violence against police

author: Erin Doherty, CNBC
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent signaled the Trump administration’s openness on Wednesday to extending President Donald Trump’s current 90-day tariff pause beyond July 9 for the United States’ top trading partners, as long as they show “good faith” in ongoing trade negotiations
title: Bessent floats extending tariff pause for countries in 'good faith' trade talks

author: Chloe Atkins
description: After nearly three months in Immigration and Customs Enforcement detention, pro-Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil made a request to move closer to his family.
title: ICE rejected Mahmoud Khalil’s request to be detained closer to newborn son, emails show

author: Aria Bendix
description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
title: RFK Jr. taps eight new members for CDC's vaccine advisory panel

author: Matt Bradley
description: The new executive chairman for the controversial Gaza Humanitarian Foundation told NBC News that to his knowledge the group is not financed by the Israel.
title: Head of controversial Gaza Humanitarian Foundation refuses to reveal who funds it

author: Greg Cergol, NBC New York
description: A just-released Peacock documentary, “The Gilgo Beach Killer: House of Secrets” takes viewers inside the Massapequa Park home of alleged serial killer Rex Heuermann
title: Daughter of Gilgo Beach suspect believes her dad is the killer. His wife isn't sold

author: Sahil Kapur
description: WASHINGTON — As Republicans barrel toward a critical deadline this summer to lift the debt ceiling, they say there’s no “Plan B” to avert an economically disastrous default if they fail to pass the massive bill for President Donald Trump's agenda in time
title: 'There is no Plan B': Republicans make a daring bet on the debt limit

author: Claire Wang
description: For the first time in two decades, older Asian Americans are no longer the healthiest U.S.-born aging racial group with the lowest rates of disability, according to a study published last month in the Journals of Gerontology.
title: U.S.-born Asian Americans no longer the healthiest group among older adults

author: NBC Washington
description: A football player who just finished eighth grade in D.C. already rakes in name, image and likeness money and has an agent to help him navigate sponsorship deals at just 14 years old
title: 14-year-old D.C. football star hires agent to navigate NIL deals

author: CNBC
description: The impacts of the pandemic-era government spending and monetary policy that helped support the U.S. economy have faded, and that makes the country vulnerable to a downturn in the coming months, according to JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon.“I think there’s a chance real numbers will deteriorate soon,” Dimon said at a Morgan Stanley conference on Tuesday, according to a transcript from FactSet
title: JPMorgan's Jamie Dimon warns U.S. economy could soon 'deteriorate'

author: Kalhan Rosenblatt
description: The video game actors' strike was suspended on Wednesday after a tentative deal with game publishers was announced, bringing an end to the union’s nearly year-long strike.
title: Video game actors’ strike ends after tentative deal is reached

author: Nidhi Sharma
description: The Environmental Protection Agency announced Wednesday that it will aim to eliminate existing limits on greenhouse gas emissions from coal- and gas-fired power plants, a move that would curb the agency’s ability to combat climate change under the Clean Air Act
title: Trump’s EPA wants to repeal regulations on carbon emissions from power plants

author: Julie Tsirkin
description: DOVER, N.J. — Republican Jack Ciattarelli won Tuesday’s primary for governor in New Jersey in part by touting President Donald Trump’s endorsement.
title: After a boost from Trump, Jack Ciattarelli pivots in the New Jersey governor's race

author: Amelia Lucas, CNBC
description: LAS VEGAS, NEV.
title: Howard Schultz says he 'did a cartwheel' when Starbucks CEO Niccol coined 'back to Starbucks' strategy

author: Adam Noboa
description: Rep. Mikie Sherrill’s Democratic primary win Tuesday concluded one of the more crowded competitive primary fields in recent memory.
title: How New Jersey's Democratic primary played out on each candidate's home turf

author: The Associated Press
description: Tyler Adams says the U.S. soccer team has tuned out criticism from former players
title: U.S. soccer team tunes out criticism from former players, Tyler Adams says

author: David K. Li
description: A Texas man was arrested and accused of spiking a romantic partner's drink with abortion-inducing medication and allegedly ending her pregnancy without consent, officials said Wednesday
title: Texas man allegedly spiked girlfriend's drink with Plan C to terminate her pregnancy, officials say

author: Emily Berk
description: Jurors in the trial against disgraced movie mogul Harvey Weinstein said Wednesday they unanimously found him guilty of sexually assaulting one woman and not guilty of assaulting another more than a decade ago
title: Jury in Harvey Weinstein sex assault retrial have reached a partial verdict

description: Singer Brian Wilson died at the age of 82. Wilson was a co-founder of the Beach Boys and was widely credited with inventing pop music as the chief songwriter of the group.
title: Beach Boys singer Brian Wilson dies at 82

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: A body has been found and confirmed to be that of missing Navy sailor Angelina Resendiz, and another sailor is in pretrial confinement in connection with her death
title: Navy sailor who vanished from Virginia barracks found dead, another sailor held in her death

author: Steve Kornacki
description: The matchup for New Jersey’s gubernatorial election is set, but looming over the contest will be a name that won’t be on any ballot: Donald Trump.Rep.
title: Steve Kornacki: The Trump factor looms over New Jersey's newly set race for governor

description: At Cherry Creek Innovation Campus in Denver, students who don’t always thrive in traditional classrooms are discovering their strengths -- and their futures -- through hands-on, purpose-driven learning. From culinary arts to aviation, cybersecurity to healthcare, this innovative model is helping young people connect their passions to real-world possibilities. This episode is part of Stay Tuned’s Learning Shift series, focused on reimagining classrooms in the wake of disruption. Sponsored by
title: Finding Their Path: How One School Helps Students Thrive by Doing

author: Daniel Arkin
description: Brian Wilson, the musical visionary who captured the optimism of early 1960s youth culture as co-founder of The Beach Boys and crafted some of the most stylistically adventurous pop of the era with the seminal album "Pet Sounds," has died, his family confirmed on Wednesday
title: Brian Wilson, influential pop pioneer and Beach Boys founding member, dies at 82

author: Rob Wile
description: NBC News reporters are looking to hear from small-business owners and entrepreneurs of all types who are experiencing changes as a result of President Donald Trump's tariff policies
title: Tell us your story: How are tariffs affecting your business?

author: The Associated Press
description: NEW YORK — Two crypto investors pleaded not guilty on Wednesday to charges they kidnapped and tortured an Italian man for his Bitcoin in an upscale Manhattan townhouse
title: 2 men plead not guilty in New York crypto kidnapping and torture case

author: Dareh Gregorian
description: President Donald Trump is set to attend the opening night of “Les Misérables,” a musical set against a background of revolution and protest, at Washington, D.C.’s John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts on Wednesday.“I love the songs, I love the play,” Trump told Fox News Digital last week.
title: Trump to attend 'Les Misérables' premiere as protests continue across the country

author: Carmen Sesin
description: While Trump's support among Cuban Americans remains strong, worries over immigration policies have begun to creep up among the multiple voters NBC News spoke to.
title: South Florida Latino Trump voters stand by him, but question his immigration policies

author: Samantha Subin, CNBC
description: Disney and Universal joined forces in a lawsuit against artificial intelligence image creator Midjourney, alleging copyright infringement, according to court filings
title: Disney and Universal sue AI image company Midjourney for unlicensed use of Star Wars, The Simpsons and more

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: You may have noticed the moon looked a little different last night — it was full, low, and in some places glowed with a bright-pink hue
title: See stunning images of June's Strawberry Moon

author: Ben Kamisar
description: Views of the U.S. and confidence in its leader to handle world affairs have taken a dive in more than a dozen countries over the last year, according to a poll from the Pew Research Center conducted over the first few months of President Donald Trump's second term.
title: Views of the U.S. under Trump dip sharply in many allied countries

description: Jane's Tuesday testimony might have given jurors the most insightful peek yet into the music mogul's mindset.
title: Sean Combs' ex-girlfriend 'Jane' returns to the stand for cross-examination

author: Saba Hamedy
description: U.S. immigration officials said they detained Khaby Lame, one of the world's most popular TikTok personalities, last week and told him to leave the country after they said he "overstayed the terms of his visa."
title: ICE says it detained TikTok star Khaby Lame and told him to leave the U.S.

description: Thousands of people across the country joined demonstrations across the country. Several more protests are planned in numerous cities today.
title: ICE prepares to deploy tactical agents to blue cities nationwide as protests spread

author: Reuters
description: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he planned to start “phasing out” the Federal Emergency Management Agency after the hurricane season and that states would receive less federal aid to respond to natural disasters
title: Trump says FEMA to be wound down after hurricane season

author: Dylan Butts, CNBC
description: Nintendo sold more than 3.5 million units of its flagship Switch 2 gaming system in the four days following its launch, with online stores of major U.S. retailers putting up “out of stock” signs.
title: U.S. online stores put 'out of stock' signs as Nintendo Switch 2 sales hit record highs

author: Richard Engel
description: Ukrainian prisoners of war have begun returning home amid a huge swap with Russia.
title: Relief for some, anguish for others as Ukrainians welcome home prisoners of war

author: Jesse Kirsch
description: From thrilling goals to devastating, knockout defeats, every four years the FIFA World Cup electrifies the globe.
title: With World Cup looming, these scientists are trying to create the perfect grass

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Authorities believe they have tracked Travis Decker, who is accused of killing his three young daughters, to a hiking area in Chelan County, Washington.
title: Authorities search hiking area for Washington father accused of killing 3 daughters

author: Mike Calia
description: The U.S. will keep high tariffs on Chinese goods, President Donald Trump announced, touting a framework that he and Chinese President Xi Jinping will need to OK.
title: Trump says China tariffs will stay high after two days of talks

description: Inflation rose 2.4% year over year and 0.1% month over month in May. NBC News' Brian Cheung and Investopedia's Editor-in-Chief Caleb Silver break down the latest inflation numbers for the U.S.
title: Inflation in May rises by 2.4% year over year and 0.1% month over month

description: Watch live coverage as Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth testifies at a Senate Appropriations Committee hearing on his department's budget.
title: Defense Secy. Hegseth testifies at Senate hearing

author: Peter Guo
description: A life-size Labubu figure has been sold in China for more than $170,000, a record for the highly sought-after toothy monster toy boosted by celebrities.
title: Life-size Labubu doll sells for over $170,000 at Beijing auction amid global frenzy

author: Chelsea Chan
description: NBA star Victor Wembanyama is visiting China, where he appears to have taken a spiritual detour at Shaolin Temple.
title: From NBA All-Star to Shaolin monk: Victor Wembanyama goes on a China retreat

author: The Associated Press
description: PITTSBURGH — Aaron Rodgers added another ring to his collection before he even signed with the Pittsburgh Steelers
title: Aaron Rodgers says he got married 'a couple of months ago'

author: The Associated Press
description: Southern Baptist delegates at their national meeting overwhelmingly endorsed a ban on gay marriage — including a call for a reversal of the Supreme Court's 10-year-old precedent legalizing it nationwide.
title: Southern Baptist delegates at national meeting overwhelmingly call for banning same-sex marriage

author: The Associated Press
description: A bison gored a man Tuesday after a large group of visitors got too close to the animal in Yellowstone National Park, officials said.
title: Bison gores man in Yellowstone after visitors get too close

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott said he’ll deploy the Texas National Guard to locations across the state “to ensure peace and order,” ahead of a planned protest in San Antonio."Peaceful protest is legal.
title: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott to deploy National Guard across the state due to protests

author: Kaylah Jackson
description: In today’s newsletter: California Governor Gavin Newsom’s fiery response to the White House’s troop deployment in Los Angeles.
title: Gavin Newsom criticizes Trump's protest tactics and May inflation concerns: Morning Rundown

author: Reuters
description: Hundreds of masked rioters attacked police and set homes and cars on fire in the Northern Irish town of Ballymena on Tuesday, in the second successive night of disorder that followed a protest over an alleged sexual assault in the town
title: Rioters attack police and torch houses for a second night in Northern Ireland

author: Greg Rosenstein
description: This was supposed to be the 'Golden Generation' of soccer players in the U.S. But 12 months out from the World Cup, many questions remain for the national team.
title: The World Cup is coming to America. Is the U.S. men's national team ready?

author: J.J. McCorvey
description: Recent policies that advocates hoped would be too popular to touch are being targeted for elimination by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau’s new leaders.
title: Consumers brace for steeper bills and lower credit scores from Trump's financial deregulation

author: Abigail Brooks
description: The team responsible for updating the CDC’s “contraception bible,” which advises doctors on birth control safety, was disbanded by the Trump administration.
title: How CDC cuts affect women with chronic diseases like sickle cell

author: The Associated Press
description: Argentina's highest court upheld a six-year prison sentence for former President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner in a ruling Tuesday that permanently banned her from public office over a corruption conviction.
title: Argentina's top court upholds 6-year prison sentence for ex-President Fernández over corruption

author: Adam Edelman
description: The moves by Gavin Newsom, JB Pritzker and Tim Walz — all potential 2028 presidential contenders — have angered some progressives and immigrants' advocates.
title: Democratic governors seek to roll back state-funded health care for undocumented immigrants

author: Henry J. Gomez
description: Sen. Elissa Slotkin has stepped onto the national stage with a "war plan" against Trump — taking a more confrontational approach than Gov. Gretchen Whitmer has.
title: In Michigan, two Democrats are generating 2028 buzz

author: Rob Wile
description: The president wants U.S. firms to “eat” the cost of his tariffs.
title: Inflation report expected to show whether companies heeded Trump's call to 'eat' tariff costs

author: Peter Nicholas
description: Donald Trump is getting the parade he wanted showcasing America’s military power — but he’ll also be getting mass protests exposing the nation’s divisions.
title: Nationwide protests loom over Trump's upcoming military parade

author: Julia Ainsley
description: A memo to immigration judges provides new insight into a tactic the Trump administration is using in a bid to increase the number of immigrants it's detaining.
title: Trump admin tells immigration judges to dismiss cases in tactic to speed up arrests

author: The Associated Press
description: Hong Kong police on Tuesday accused a mobile game application of advocating armed revolution and promoting secessionist agendas, saying that those who publish it or share it with others online may risk violating national security laws.
title: Hong Kong police accuse a mobile game app of promoting armed revolution

author: Patrick Smith
description: A reunion of the world's richest man and the most powerful may not be imminent, but at least one of them has now expressed his regrets as their relationship lies in ruins
title: Elon Musk says he now 'regrets' some of his social media posts about Trump after major fallout

author: The Associated Press
description: Palestinians desperately trying to access aid in Gaza came under fire again Tuesday, killing 36 people and wounding 207, the Palestinian Health Ministry said.
title: 36 Palestinians killed trying to obtain desperately needed aid in Gaza, officials say

author: The Associated Press
description: Survivors and family members of the 49 victims killed in the Pulse nightclub massacre nine years ago are getting their first chance Wednesday to walk through the long-shuttered, LGBTQ+-friendly Florida venue.
title: Pulse massacre survivors are set to revisit the nightclub before it's razed

author: The Associated Press
description: Seven people were killed in Colombia as rebel groups detonated bombs near police stations in the city of Cali and the neighboring Cauca province.
title: Bomb attacks in Colombia kill 7 with senator critical after shooting

author: Reuters
description: The two Chinese aircraft carriers spotted conducting simultaneous operations in the Pacific for the first time send a political message about the country’s “expansionist“ aims, Taiwan Defence Minister Wellington Koo said on Wednesday.
title: Chinese carriers in Pacific show country's 'expansionist' aims, Taiwan says

author: The Associated Press
description: Britain, Australia, Canada, New Zealand and Norway said Tuesday they have imposed sanctions on two far-right Israeli government ministers for allegedly "inciting extremist violence" against Palestinians in the Israeli-occupied West Bank.
title: U.K., Canada, Australia and others sanction 2 far-right Israeli ministers for 'inciting extremist violence'

author: Eunice Yoon, CNBC
description: Electric vehicle makers in China, led by the country’s market leader BYD, have been engaged in a bruising price war, depressing profits in the industry.
title: A new car for $7,700: In China, fears grow of an EV financial crisis amid pricing war

description: Los Angeles City Councilman Hugo Soto-Martínez spoke out about the impact of ICE raids on the city, calling the situation “unprecedented” and saying it has created a sense of “absolute terror” throughout the community.
title: L.A. councilman says ICE raids are creating 'absolute terror' in community

author: Bridget Bowman
description: The matchup in New Jersey's race for governor is officially set — and Tuesday’s primaries also laid down big indicators about the state of both political parties after the first major intraparty contests since the 2024 election
title: Five takeaways from New Jersey's primaries for governor: How the candidates are handling Trump and more

author: Zoë Richards
description: The California governor has clashed with Trump in recent days over the president's deployment of the National Guard to quell protests in Los Angeles.
title: Gavin Newsom warns 'democracy is under assault' in speech blasting Trump's immigration tactics

author: Reuters
description: A federal appeals court allowed President Donald Trump’s most sweeping tariffs to remain in effect on Tuesday while it reviews a lower court decision blocking them on grounds that Trump had exceeded his authority by imposing them
title: Trump tariffs may remain in effect while appeals proceed, federal appeals court rules

description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom responded to President Donald Trump deploying the National Guard in response to anti-ICE raid protests. Newsom warned that other states could be next, and said Trump “chose escalation.”
title: Gov. Newsom: ‘Trump chose theatrics over public safety’

description: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass declared a local emergency and issued a curfew for downtown L.A., from 8 p.m. to 6 a.m., in an effort to “stop the vandalism.” Bass said several businesses have been affected by the looting and urged individuals to avoid the area.
title: Los Angeles mayor announces curfew amid protests against ICE raids

author: Evelyn Cheng, CNBC
description: The U.S. and China have reached consensus on trade, representatives from both sides said following a second day of high-level talks in London, according to an NBC transcript.“We have reached a framework to implement the Geneva consensus and the call between the two presidents,” U.S.
title: China and U.S. agree on framework to implement Geneva trade consensus

author: Bridget Bowman
description: Democratic Rep. Mikie Sherrill and Republican Jack Ciattarelli have won their parties’ primaries for governor in New Jersey, NBC News projects, setting up one of the most closely watched races of the year.
title: New Jersey governor's race is set as Mikie Sherrill and Jack Ciattarelli win their primaries

author: Adam Reiss
description: Three real estate brothers accused of a scheme to sex traffic women across multiple states and Mexico were in a federal courtroom in New York on Tuesday to face a third superseding indictment.
title: More accusations added to federal sex trafficking case against Alexander brothers
